page.title: 02Physical Features
page.content:
The land is mainly undulating. The River Severn lies to the west, the River Salwarpe and the (now disused but being restored) Droitwich Canal joining it in the block. The canal - which was built for transporting salt from Droitwich - roughly follows the line of the Salwarpe.
The Northern Link Road traverses the block, linking the M5 motorway with the A449 trunk road. There is a junction with the Link Road with Hurst Lane by the Blackpole Industrial Estate. The A38 trunk road also traverses the block and the Worcester/Birmingham railway runs through also; the halt at Fernhill Heath was closed in the 1960's.
